comments.body:
I haven't seen this `$ExpectType` reference before, a quick google search made reference to an eslint plugin, do you know if it is installed?

Have you verified this test is working as expected?

This is how type assertions work in dtslint, which is the tool used to test types in DefinitelyTyped. https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped#running-tests

There are 3 types of assertions:

1. Making sure TypeScript doesn’t complain
2. Assert a specific type using `// $ExpectType`
3. Assert a type doesn’t match using `// $ExpectError`

I hope this helps you write type definitions in the future. :)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +49,53 @@
app.use(ctx => {
    ctx.accepts(); // $ExpectType string[]
    ctx.accepts(''); // $ExpectType string | false
    ctx.accepts(['']); // $ExpectType string | false
